III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member pushed youth one time at an unknown date. Youth
was not injured but felt unsafe on three different occasions. The
incidents occurring in this placement are causing significant
mental distress for youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source 1 was interviewed via phone on November 14,
2023. She reported on November 13, 2023, Youth A came in for a
routine medical appointment and reported he did not feel safe at the
facility. Complaint Source 1 reported he disclosed Staff 1 had pushed
him and he does not feel safe at the facility. She reported there were
no marks or bruises found on Youth A. When asked for more
information, Youth A just continued to report he wanted to live in a
foster home. Complaint Source 1 reported the only concern Youth A
noted was the push that took place with Staff 1.
Supervisor 1/ Complaint Source 2 was interviewed via phone on
November 14, 2203. Supervisor 1 reported on November 13, 2023,
Youth A was taken to a routine medical appointment by Staff 2. She
reported she received a phone call from Staff 2 due to Youth A
reporting to the medical providers he did not feel safe at the facility
because Staff 1 had pushed him. Supervisor 1 reported it was found
Youth A had disclosed to Supervisor 2 a couple of weeks ago that on
October 31, 2023, Staff 1 had pushed him. Supervisor 1 reported
Supervisor 2 had reviewed the video footage when the reported
concern was made and there was no evidence of a push occurring.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on November
16, 2023. Interpreter was present to provide translation. Youth A
reported on October 31, 2023, he was playing cricket outside and
when he came back inside his knee was hurting from being out in the
cold. He reported he put the cricket items away in the staff-only area
and he sat down in the chair because his knee was hurting. Youth A
reported Staff 1 was telling him that he could not sit there and
needed to get up or he would get a minus on his behavior sheet. He
reported when he got up Staff 1 followed behind him with her one
hand on his back pushing him along because he was not moving fast
enough. Youth A reported he yelled at Staff 1 for pushing him. He
reported he did not get hurt by the situation but knows that staff are
not allowed to push youth. Youth A reported no other staff or youth
2

saw this situation occur. He reported he told Supervisor 2 about this
concern, and he did not do anything about it. Youth A denied ever
watching the video footage of this. When asked if there were any
other concerns at the facility, Youth A reported he does not like that
staff can give him a minus mark and wants to move to a foster home.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on November
16, 2023. Staff 1 reported she was working on October 31, 2023,
with Staff 3 and Staff 4. She reported Youth A had been playing
cricket outside and came back in. Staff 1 reported Youth A entered
the staff-only area and put away the cricket items. She reported
Youth A took a seat in the chair even though he was told he needed
to leave the area. Staff 1 reported Youth A began to argue stating
that he was 18 years old and could stay in the staff-only area. She
reported herself, Staff 3, and Staff 4 continued to encourage Youth A
to leave the area. Staff 1 reported Youth A got up off the chair and
she followed behind him. She reported while he was walking out of
the area, she put her hand on his back to help guide him. Staff 1
reported she never pushed him, and Youth A was walking on his own
accord. She stated she wanted to help encourage him to leave. Staff
1 reported Youth A did not like that and began to state she pushed
him. Staff 1 reported once he made a comment about her hand on
his back, she removed her hand, and he was already out of the area.
She reported Staff 3 and Staff 4 both told Youth A she did not push
him. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 2 made her aware Youth A did make
a complaint about this. She reported she also watched the video to
review the situation again. Staff 1 reported she is aware staff cannot
push youth at the facility and stated that she has never done so.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 16, 2023. Supervisor 2 reported he was not present when
the reported push occurred but was on shift later that day on October
31, 2023. He reported Youth A reported Staff 1 had shoved him.
Supervisor 2 reported Youth A had no concerns about physically
being hurt but appeared to be more emotionally hurt by the situation.
He reported Youth A also reported a lot of personal concerns about
what is going on with his family in another country. Supervisor 2
reported he reviewed the video footage due to the concerns Youth A
had reported and he did not see any evidence of a push or shove
occurring. Supervisor 2 reported the youth are not supposed to be in
the staff-only area due to confidential information and reported in the
video you can see staff attempting to encourage Youth A to leave.
He reported he saw Staff 1 put her hand on Youth A’s back to
encourage him to leave but there was never any push or shove.
Supervisor 2 reported he reviewed the video footage as well with
Youth A to show there was no evidence of a push occurring. He
stated he also spoke to Staff 1 about the situation.
3

Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on November
16, 2023. Staff 3 reported he was working on October 31, 2023, and
was sitting in the staff-only area when Youth A came in. He reported
he, Staff 1, and Staff 4 were verbally redirecting Youth A to leave the
area when Youth A sat down. Staff 3 reported there was never a
concern reported from Youth A that his knee was hurting. He
reported when Youth A got up to leave, Staff 1 stood behind Youth A
and put her hand on his back to help guide him. He reported there
was never any force from Staff 1’s hand on Youth A’s back. Staff 3
reported when a youth comes into the staff-only area staff are to
continue to redirect the youth to leave. He reported he has no
concerns with Staff 1’s interactions with the youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on November
16, 2023. Staff 4 reported he was working on October 31, 2023. He
stated he was sitting in the staff-only area with Staff 1 and Staff 3
when Youth A came into the area. Staff 4 reported Youth A was
encouraged by all the staff that he needed to leave the area. He
reported there was never a concern from Youth A of his knee being
in pain. He stated after multiple verbal redirections from all the staff,
Youth A got up off the chair and Staff 1 stood up with him. Staff 4
reported he saw Staff 1 put her hand on Youth A’s back to encourage
him to leave but never used any force. He stated Youth A then began
to state Staff 1 was pushing him and Staff 1 moved her hand. Staff 4
reported he told Youth A that Staff 1 was not pushing him by any
means. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 is very motherly with all the youth and
always encourages them to do their best. He reported he has no
concerns with Staff 1’s ability to do her job. Staff 4 reported since the
last investigation where a staff member was let go, the youth have
been making comments about getting staff they do not like fired. Staff
4 reported Staff 1 did nothing wrong and was using verbal redirection
when Youth A was in the area where he was not supposed to be.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on November
16, 2023. Staff 2 reported she brought Youth A to the medical
appointment on November 14, 2023, for a routine check-up. She
reported he met with the medical professionals alone at one point
and the medical social worker had talked to her about Youth A
disclosing reports of being abused at the facility. Staff 2 reported she
texted Supervisor 1 about the concern immediately as there was no
other information given at that time. She reported when driving Youth
A back to the facility he reported that he did not like Staff 1 and
stated that she had pushed him when he was in the staff-only area.
Staff 2 reported she did not ask him any more questions at that time.
She stated that she had not seen any concerns with Staff 1’s
interaction with the youth and noted that it is a rule that staff cannot
push the youth. She reported if a youth is in the staff-only area staff
are to encourage them to leave.
4

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on November
16, 2023. Interpreter was present to provide translation. Youth B
reported things are going very well at the facility and he is treated
with respect by the staff at the facility. He reported he has never seen
a staff treat another youth poorly or push them. When asked if there
is any area a youth cannot be in at the facility, Youth B talked about
the staff-only area. Youth B reported he has seen staff verbally
encourage youth to leave the area and never has seen staff put their
hands on youth to move them out of the area.
Video Footage Reviewed:
Video footage of 10/31/2023 was reviewed on 11/16/2023, in
collaboration with Supervisor 1. It should be noted the video footage
does not have any audio. The video starts with Staff 1 sitting at one
of the computer desks near the back of the staff-only area, Staff 4
sitting in front of Staff 1 at another computer desk area and Staff 3
sitting near the front entrance of the staff-only area. Youth A walks
into the staff-only area with a cricket bat and ball in his hand. He first
walks past Staff 3 and hands him the ball and then puts the cricket
bat behind where Staff 1 is sitting. Youth A then sat in a chair behind
where Staff 1 was sitting. Staff 1 turns around and points to the exit
area and appears to be talking to Youth A. Staff 1 does it again and
Staff 4 turns around and appears to be talking to Youth A. Staff 3
talks to another youth and then gets up out of the staff area. Staff 3
then gets up and turns back to the staff-only area and looks at Youth
A. Staff 1 gets up from her seat and turns to Youth A and points to
the exit area of the staff-only area. At this point, Staff 3 and Staff 4
are facing the direction of Youth A. After 40 seconds from the start of
Youth A sitting down in the chair, he gets up and faces Staff 1. Youth
A then turns and starts to walk out of the staff-only area and Staff 1 is
right behind him. Youth A then stops near the entrance of the staff-
only area and appears to be standing there talking to someone with
his hands on his hips. Staff 1 is behind Youth A and while he is
standing there, she places both of her hands on his back. She then
walks with him the last two steps out of the staff area with her hands
on his back. This is occurring right in the eyesight of both Staff 3 and
Staff 4. Once Youth A was out of the area he turned and looked back
at Staff 1. Youth B was also standing at the front of the entrance area
of the staff-only area. The video ended as Youth A walked away.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Bethany Employee Handbook- Staff are prohibited from the
use of physical or verbal harassment, violence, abuse, threats
or intimation towards a youth.
- Bethany Christan Services Emergency Restraint Policy-
This policy states pushing a youth on any part of their body is
prohibited.
5

- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has no disciplinary
action noted with her file. Staff 1 is up to date on all her
training including CPI training dated 2/15/2023.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and video footage reviewed there
no evidence to support Staff 1 pushed Youth A. The video footage
showed Staff 1 helped guide Youth A out of the staff only area.
Youth A did not report any other occasions of feeling mental
destress and reported he would just like to be moved into a family
setting.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
